articles.author: Valérie Ouellet,Sylvène Gilchrist
articles.title: Some prisoners not offered COVID-19 shots until months after general public, CBC analysis finds
articles.description: More than 6,700 prisoners across Canada have tested positive for COVID-19 — a rate much higher than the general population. Yet a CBC News analysis has found that in some facilities, prisoners waited until May for their chance at a first vaccination.
articles.content:
Deepan Budlakoti describes the rollout plan for the COVID-19 vaccine at the Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre as "a piece of paper put on the wall." 
It read: If you want a vaccine, put in for a vacc… [+11549 chars]

articles.author: Stephanie Levitz - Ottawa Bureau
articles.title: How Justin Trudeau’s Liberals plan to take back Atlantic Canada
articles.description: In 2015, the Liberals swept all 32 seats in Atlantic Canada and won a majority. In 2019, they lost. Now they want it back.

articles.title: Meet the smart cart tech firm retrofitting existing grocery carts - Grocery Dive
articles.description: In another sign of the technology's growing popularity, Israeli startup WalkOut has made a plug-and-play option that costs less than other high-tech carts on the market.
articles.content:

articles.title: Shrinking giants: North Atlantic right whales getting tinier
articles.description: A new study says the hulking giants of the deep, North Atlantic right whales, are on average about three feet shorter than just 20 years ago
articles.content:
One of the giants of the deep is shrinking before our eyes, a new study says.
